titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Fletcher Nelson Papers, 1901-1981 UA.29.02.0226
titlestmt.author: Matthew Schaefer

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2015-07-30 05:05:27 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: This collection contains the papers of Dr. Fletcher Nelson, a Methodist minister and Assistant to the Dean of Development of the Duke Divinity School. It consists entirely of subject files and notes for the sermons Dr. Nelson gave during his career as a minister.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of two series, the first of which consists of subject files containing publications related to topics on which Dr. Nelson preached. The second series consists of sermons Dr. Nelson wrote and gave while he was an active minister in Greensboro, Rutherfordton, Forest City, Morganton, and Charlotte, North Carolina.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions described in this finding aid: UA86-24

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Fletcher Nelson Papers, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Fletcher Nelson Papers were received by the Duke University Archives as a transfer in March, 1986.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48-hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Dr. Fletcher Nelson was born on August 29, 1904. After completing his undergraduate studies at Hendrix College, he enrolled at Duke University Divinity School in 1927 and graduated with a B.D. in 1930. Upon his graduation, Dr. Nelson was ordained deacon on trial in the Western North Carolina Conference, and two years later he received elder's orders and was made a full member of the conference. He was a pastor in a variety of parishes in North Carolina until 1950. In 1952, he received the Doctor of Divinity Degree, honoris causa, from Duke University Divinity School. In 1964, he was appointed Assistant to the Dean of Development at Duke University Divinity School and stayed in that position until his retirement in 1971. Dr. Nelson died on February 8, 1981.
